column4: hey on old ubuntu there is option System->LockScreen.  Can I install that in 7.04 ?
MiB = Million Bytes, which is the same as MegaBytes
technically not the same but close enough unless you are counting cylinder heads
swap space is for losers anyways just get more ram
lol
hibernation doesn't work so good
this page has the mathematics as well: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gigabyte
megabyte MB = mebibyte (MiB),  they are just SI versus Binary prefixes.
!dualhead | fuzzy_logic
thanks will look at that
what i understand from it is that it only supports xfree86.. but i use xorg..
xinerama ?
no.. that dualhead
try xinerama then
xinerama does exactly what i don't want.. i don't want 1 large.. i want 2 seperate but with the possibility to drag windows from one to another..
I guess you would have to get dual output video card then
i will see if mine supports it.. but maybe it doesn't, that's a good suggestion.. much thanks
I have an ati radeon with dual output and it works like you want.  2 separate desktops with drag between
I use the vga cable for one and dvi out for the other
i have a laptop and a monitor, but i would like to have the monitor and the laptop screen.. maybe that's the problem, that it isn't a regular screen?
I think the best you can get with that setup is one desktop spanning both with xinerama.
ok thanks
